name: Walafrid Strabo
summary: Walafrid Strabo was a Benedictine monk, scholar, and poet of the Carolingian Renaissance. He was abbot of Reichenau Abbey and a student of Rabanus Maurus. He wrote theological works, poetry, and biblical commentaries. He is sometimes credited (though incorrectly) with the Glossa Ordinaria, a standard medieval biblical commentary. He was a key figure in the intellectual culture of the Carolingian court.
